item.title: [REAL]Skill menus(317)
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Mental Piracy:

Someone told me this can be shortened a lot more. I was wondering if anyone had any idea how? I guess I could combine all the lines of the interface into 1 method, but then it would get really ugly and annoying. Since I still enjoy the learning part any way to shorten this up some more and an explanation of usage and why would be appreciated

Could be shortened with variable arguments. Also, could reduce ALL those cases to make it match an array.

Read full topic

item.title: [REAL]Skill menus(317)
item.dc:creator: @Souls2 Souls`
item.description:
@Souls2 wrote:

[code]package server.model.players.skills;

import server.model.players.Client;[/code]

Change it to: import server.model.player.client;

Don’t use capitals.

Read full topic

item.title: [REAL]Skill menus(317)
item.dc:creator: @SmDaRgOn SmDaRgOn
item.description:
@SmDaRgOn wrote:

Very nice, it works great and oh, for the kids that can’t get this working… Learn a few things first, packaging isn’t rocket science, it’s merely a few lines of code. Reword it and you have your skill interfaces.

Mental Piracy put a lot of effort into this so that people could use it for their own. When you can’t package something or don’t know what “cannot find symbol” means it begins to annoy numerous of people and Mental Piracy being one of them.

If you know what you’re doing I’d suggest adding this. If you don’t… Learn a few things first then come and add it.

Other than that…

Great work.

Read full topic

^ .\client.java:20768: cannot find symbol symbol : method getPA() location: class client c.getPA().sendFrame126(levels, 8720 + lineCounter); ^ .\client.java:20777: cannot find symbol symbol : method getPA() location: class client c.getPA().sendFrame126("", i); You do not have a PlayerAssistant.java. Your sendframes are probably located in client class. Just remove the .getPA(). and leave it as c.sendFrame126
